PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Miss Nan Dennis, 222 Foxhurst Drive, and Miss Molly Woomer, 5025 Fifth Avenue, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 21, 1958, pg. 5, with question: "Do you think that the city needs a fair housing ordinance?" Answer from Miss Nan Dennis reads: �I don�t think that it�s right to bar people from a neighborhood because of race or creed.� Answer from Miss Molly Woomer reads: �I think that it would be good.  To discriminate is against the principle of democracy.�
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Nan Dennis, and Molly Woomer wearing striped dress with large collar and dark bow, holding Joseph Horne Co gift box, standing on sidewalk next to garbage can that reads "Help Keep..." with buildings, including one with sign that reads "Rega[l]" and pedestrians in background
